author: agnxsh
content:
<@288990561279541248> or <@1351272205555863614> can anyone of you update the nimbus BNs to `getBlobsV2-3a473f0`, this image should be bug-free in terms of getBlobsV2 and payloadV5, however it doesn't backfill, we're writing/testing a single simplified backfill/column-sync that is supposed to work with validator custody as well and that should take more time to test and debug, so on column serving guarantees, i'm _still not_ 100% certain.

also, i'm not in control of EL related OOM/cpu issues if there are any. ðŸ™‚

author: agnxsh
content: in the devnet you guys have spun

author: agnxsh
content: also just to note this image doesn't support `DataColumnIdentifiers` yet, which is `indices` instead of `index`, request to CLs to still support the former for some time, in this devnet.

author: agnxsh
content: `getBlobsV2-3a473f0` not ~~`getBlobs-3a473f0`~~ my mistake

author: hangleang.eth
content: speaking of `getBlobsV2`, do ELs already adopt the all or null response as [the spec said](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/osaka.md#engine_getblobsv2) ? we need to update the response type on CLs as well

author: sunnysidedj_42398
content: Hi <@785811170387951616> thank you for the update, and thank you <@498331483732312075>, <@360491619402776577> and <@334704997122179072>  for asking and answering whether ELs are ready for the change. We have Geth, Nethermind and Reth ELs running with Nimbus at the moment. Could anyone from Reth tell us whether you guys are ready?

author: sunnysidedj_42398
content: Maybe we can try for some of the instances if it feels slightly risky?

author: agnxsh
content: reth is working well

author: agnxsh
content: <@412614104222531604> spamoor occassionally crashes in the new cell/ new txn config, as in runs well for 20-25 mins, then the container simply stops and shuts down

author: agnxsh
content:
```
participants:
  - el_type: reth
    el_image: ethpandaops/reth:rkrasiuk-peerdas
    cl_type: nimbus
    cl_image: ethpandaops/nimbus-eth2:getBlobsV2
    count: 3
  - el_type: reth
    el_image: ethpandaops/reth:rkrasiuk-peerdas
    cl_type: nimbus
    cl_image: ethpandaops/nimbus-eth2:getBlobsV2
    cl_extra_params: [--debug-peerdas-supernode=true]
    count: 3
network_params:
  electra_fork_epoch: 0
  fulu_fork_epoch: 1
  max_blobs_per_block_fulu: 9
  target_blobs_per_block_fulu: 12
#snooper_enabled: true
global_log_level: debug
additional_services:
  - dora
  - spamoor
  - prometheus_grafana
spamoor_params:
  image: ethpandaops/spamoor:blob-v1
  spammers:
    - scenario: blob-combined
      config:
        throughput: 6 # 6 blob tx per block
        sidecars: 2   # up to 2 sidecars per tx
        blob_v1_percent: 100 # submit 100% of the txs as blob v1
```

content: kurto config i am using

author: marcopolo__
content: Do we have data or maybe a report for how Gossipsub's `IDONTWANT` has behaved on Hoodi?

author: parithosh
content: We dont really have a "before" state for hoodi, since IDONTWANT was available since the start of the network. Holesky had issues that meant we couldnt really analyze it properly. Sepolia might be a candidate? However the current plan is to wait for pectra on mainnet and analyze it there (not enough nodes have updated to support IDONTWANT msgs as of last week, but we assume they will for the fork)

author: marcopolo__
content: That makes sense. I think we could still get some useful information without the before state as well. For example, knowing how many times you _would have_ sent a message to a peer if not for `IDONTWANT` could be helpful.

author: parithosh
content: cc <@293154341127454721> in case you guys have some spare cycles
